dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A young man, FREDDIE SUTTON (early 20s)_ speaks to a

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you going to do when you get out of here? You're going to have to wear a belt for six months, maybe a year...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What kind of belt?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A surgical belt. You won't be able to do very heavy lifting.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: .I try to stay away from that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But you spend time outdoors.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you do?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You didn't have very much on you when you were admitted. Where were you going?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I was on my way to Placerville. To the Fair. Had a job waiting for me, with a friend of mine. He doesn't know where I am.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How old are you, Freddie?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why don't you turn honest? You seem like an intelligent fellow. 'Quick on your feet - you like to drink?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's a weakness. But I like it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know what the other is too.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How can you tell that? I'm clean.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The tattoo's.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is that a weakness...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No one ever made money chasing girls.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're wrong. This tatoo's my Auntie.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who's that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My Auntie Bertha, (she raised me.) But that doesn't mean I don't have a weakness...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: College?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I tried that, it didn't work.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why'd you leave?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sometimes my hypo's get the best of me, I really feel like walking into the street and hitting people's hats off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's how you end up like this. With a burst appendix.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's when I know it's time to get to the sea.. what kind of belt?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A medical belt. Similar for lifting. You're going to need some money. What do you plan to do?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm going to pay back the hospital. And you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You don't owe me anything. I'm on surgical duty. But you're expected to pay the hospital for medicines. And your belt.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alright. I intend to do that. You saying you have a job for me? What? As an orderly?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You couldn't be an orderly, it's too much lifting -- and a lot of things you'd have to learn. But maybe you could run an elevator, something of that sort.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I want to get out of here, but I also like it here. You think I was gonna die?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know you were, Freddie.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know. I'm not saying you didn't save me... . but...I can't seem to die.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Too lucky?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Something like that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Were you in the service?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, sir.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Navy?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your luck was up this time, Freddie. You should have seen the pus in your belly. Something to think about. It's not too late to stop being a weisnheimer, no matter what you think. you're still a young man.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: FREDDIE sitting in a chair, running the elevator. bored. Moving up and down.. .START MUSIC. CARRIES OVER THE FOLLOWING SEQUENCE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: FREDDIE, middle of the night, sneaks across the ward to a sleeping patient's bed. He goes into the drawer next to the bed, grabs WALLET/CASH

dialogues.speaker: HALLWAY, DOCTOR'S OFFICE
dialogues.text: Freddie places a note on the door of the Doctor. He walks away, CAMERA sees the note, it reads:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: FREDDIE amongst a GROUP OF MEN playing cards, dice, etc, in a backroom gambling hall. He collects some money and leaves. VERY VERY SMOKY HERE.

dialogues.speaker: EXT. ALLEY WAY
dialogues.text: Freddie walks into the alley, stuffing some money in his pockets - he's followed by a FIGURE. FREDDIE realizes, stops, SPINS AROUND AND PULLS KNIFE:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You come any closer and I'll slice your

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not after your dough, I just want to talk with you -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You can talk standing in front of the restaurant, around the corner -- At that moment, TWO OTHER MEN come out of the shadows and JUMP FREDDIE, KNOCK HIM AROUND, TAKE HIS MONEY AND LEAVE. He's left a little bloody, messy, no money in the alley.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: FREDDIE's got a job working in the PORTRAIT STUDIO OF AN OAKLAND, CALIFORNIA DEPARTMENT STORE. He looks from behind the old camera, getting reactions. WE SEE THE

dialogues.speaker: COUPLES, YOUTHFUL JUST MARRIED COUPLES. GET THEIR PHOTO'S
dialogues.text: TAKEN. He interacts with them all.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CAMERA leads around a beautiful young woman names: DONNA (20) who is modelling a FUR COAT for the FEMALE CUSTOMERS in the COSMETICS SECTION.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hand made. Imported. Chinchilla. Only

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She catches the eye of FREDDIE watching her. She moves around snaking towards him.. .CAMERAГ‚В° leads him out of PHOTO DEPARTMENT and towards her, and they meet in the

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Only $49.99, hand-made, imported.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You have a break coming?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 15 minutes. A BACK HALLWAY, BACK CLOSET, MOMENTS LATER. He gets his little FLASK out...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I saw you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I saw you first.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's your name?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Donna. What's yours?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Freddie.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's a nice name.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is homemade..

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is it gonna kill me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes. She sips it. Makes a face. Horrible.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uugugh.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Taste good?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah. They kiss each other.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I have an apricot belly. Want to see it? She shows him her stomach.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm really a very good girl. What gives you this idea about me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe we think the same things at the same time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh my good-ness. I think we do. Want to see my boobs?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes. She pulls her top down, the coat drapped around her-reveals her breasts -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are they nice?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hand made. Chinchilla. Imported. That's enough. She pulls her top back up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wanna go out tonight?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Of course. Gllllagh. What's in this? I think I'm cross eyed for good.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't have any cigarettes...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you make this liquor with?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's secrets in liquor, this is just booze.

dialogues.speaker: EXT. DEPARTMENT STORE. MOMENTS LATER.
dialogues.text: They exit, move away from each other, both drunk..

dialogues.speaker: INT. PORTRAIT STUDIO AREA. LATER.
dialogues.text: FREDDIE is very drunk and dealing with a very IRRITABLE/VAIN BUSINESS MAN who can't stop doing his hair ...FREDDIE makes some smart ass comments (TBD) to TH MAN. They argue back and forth until:

dialogues.speaker: RAVING AT THIS MAN.
dialogues.text: SECURITY GUARDS come after him, Freddie runs off, through the store -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe a few months later, FREDDIE looks worse for wear. He's been hired to work at a BEET DISTILLATE as a BENCH CHEMIST. The FOREMAN walks him though the process; it's clear that there is enough chemicals and beets here to make some good booze... MEXICAN and FILIPINO workers HARVEST THE BEETS, load them to wagons - unload/wash - end up with FREDDIE: He works the bench, making his HOME MADE VODKA. This stuff is quite toxic and very strong. He places it in small, side

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Freddie and all the workers getting ready for a night out. He's got the Fillipino's and Mexican's working for him squeezing Lemons and Limes, Apples, Beet Juice, in with HOMEMADE POTION.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A LOCAL DANCE HALL outside SALINAS. SCENE BEGINS IN THE MIDDLE OF A FIGHT WITH FREDDIE/FARM WORKERS and some LOCAL KIDS. FREDDIE is very very VISCIOUS IN THIS FIGHT.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All of the MEN with Freddie have piled into a car. There is one FILLIPINO MAN who is extremely drunkHe's passing out and moaning a little... His young FRIEND says, "he drank way too much."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: .somebody shut him up..

dialogues.speaker: INT. BEET/SUGAR FACTORY. BUNKHOUSE. LATER
dialogues.text: It's the middle of the night and all the WORKERS, including FREDDIE are asleep. Across the room the DRUNK FILIPINO's condition has gotten worse... The YOUNGER FILIPINO MAN wakes others up for help. . .The DRUNKEN MAN is mumbling "I'm blind.." "I'm dying.." "my eyes.."

dialogues.speaker: HAVE SOMETHING TO DO WITH THIS...
dialogues.text: .he backs away quietly-and starts to THROW SOME THINGS INTO A BAG...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LATER. off the side of the highway. Freddie collects himself, obviously running for the past hour and evading the Filipino's. He hitches now...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Inside the crowded HIRING HALL, sailors, men looking for work, etc. Freddie puts his name down. This is a short burst of a scene, establish he wants to get back to sea, wants work, but there's nothing for a few weeks. EXT. DOCKS/SAN FRANCISCO - NIGHT. VARIOUS ANGLES. Freddie makes his way around the docks, looking for something/anything. PLAY OUT. He comes across a SHIP that's being readied for voyage. It's an old cattle TRAWLER that seems converted to some kind of CRUISE SHIP/PRIVATE YACHT-type vessel. There's a buzz of getting ready around the ship also a minor cocktail party in progress. (light music playing from the ship...) DECKHANDS preparing to ship out, etc... Freddie approaches the gang-plank...no one is there to guard it. He walks straight up the gang plank and gets on board the ship. ANGLE, ON BOARD. CAMERA follows him around... no one seems to notice or care... He goes down below... ANGLE, BELOW DECK. He sneaks around... some YOUNG MEN are getting dressed in TUXEDOS.

This plays itself out...FREDDIE finds a small CLOSET with a TUXEDO and slips it on. He gets swallowed up into this group of young men and acts as if he belongs -- .THE SHIP PULLS AWAY. HEADING OUT SAN FRANCISCO BAY... .FREDDIE HEADING UP INTO A WELL APPOINTED CABIN... A COCKTAIL PARTY IS IN FULL SWING AS THE SHIP LEAVES S.F. There are all manner of people here, in this area, everyone seems quite happy, chatty. Middle aged couples, single middle-aged men, young couples, some kids, teenagers, etc. Freddie working near the bar, starts delivering drinks... A live PIANO TRIO playing. FREDDIE NOTICES: A LARGE MAN IN HIS MID-40s, all red-hair, red eyebrows, red lips sings and dances while holding a baby It's a bit blurry across the room from Freddie's POV The SONG ENDS and everyone laughs, applauds, collapses. KIDS run around...

dialogues.speaker: INT. MAIN DINNER CABIN. LATER.
dialogues.text: Everyone seated for DINNER; we now see the red haired man in full: MASTER OF CEREMONIES (early 40s) He sits at the head of the table, his family with him: HIS WIFE: MARY SUE (pregnant, mid-20s) HIS DAUGHTERS:

dialogues.speaker: ELIZABETH, (18)
dialogues.text: A RIGHT HAND MAN TO MASTER IS: NORMAN CONRAD (40s) ANGLE, THE BAR. The BARTENDER whispers to Freddie; indicates he's POURED TWO SHOTS FOR THEM TO SNEAK ... FREDDIE and the BARTENDER reach and grab them, shoot them back... INSTANTLY, FREDDIE'S HEAD POUNDS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You feel alright?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, fine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why don't you go lay down, I'll take over... Freddie walks off. FREDDIE doesn't seem DRUNK he SEEMS DRUGGED. He walks down the hall - AND IN AN INSTANT FALLS FLAT ON HIS FACE. DEAD WEIGHT. He's dragged off. FADE OUT.

dialogues.text: You make me feel like I'm in hell. lemme wake up or lemme sleep.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well you shouldnt drink so much liquor, it's bad for the system. You're hurting yourself. PAUSE. Freddie is slipping out of it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Would you like to stay with us a little while?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sure.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We can give you the guidance you need in your life.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thanks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We can give you the guidance you need in your life.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thanks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why you don't you just get some more rest?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LONG PAUSE. Freddie's eyes close ane he passes out again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This boy is just a simple stow-away. All things he says he is.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I believe... Master fiddles around with his things, belongings, wallet, out on a table. He looks at the FLASK. Smells it. Pours the contents into a glass; looks at the liquid.
He drinks it. He lets it run down his body, feels the drink. He drinks some more.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Delicious... delicious

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There should be nothing above suspicion.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: FREDDIE is dragged by to ASSISTANTS down the narrow hallways of the SHIP. . .down another hallway, down another...

dialogues.speaker: CU. FREDDIE.
dialogues.text: Morning sun comes in, hits him in the face. Wakes him up. He looks around. He looks out the window.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: FREDDIE walks out, looks around. . .he walks down the hal a YOUNG GIRL passes him, smiles wide and says "GOOD MORNING," ad keeps walking... He moves towards a room where he hears a TYPEWRITER. He steps in the doorway. MASTER sits at his desk, writing gear all around. MASTER looks up, sees him, stops typing... Smiles. Extends his arm out for Freddie to come in and take a seat.. .MASTER is warm, inviting. Not rushed. They sort of sit and settle with each a moment;

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ok?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alright.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You can't be...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is this your ship?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm it's Commander, yes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where's it going?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: New York City thru the canal. You're seamen?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're looking for work?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: .what did I say last night...?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You said you were an able bodied seamen and you were looking for work?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You have any?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Perhaps.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What was in my drink?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You were sedated with chloral hydrate and bubble gum kisses. Ha ha ha. I'm sure if your check your butt-hole you'll find it's all in working order (he he he...) Isn't that what all men are worried about in they surrender themselves.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I didn't surrender myself.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You were acting very aggressive because you drank too much alcohol.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't think I was.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes I think you were. And I don't like strange boys jumping on my ship.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So what are you gonna do?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why don't you just ask for work? Work can't be hard to find.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Depends on when you're ready to go...do you have a job for me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You can't work in your condition.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What condition is that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're aberrated.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's that mean?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A wandering from the path The problems you have in your life (your appendix, your work, your need to batter your body with booze...) I resolve that they can be fixed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've got no trouble. You got a job for me to do, I can do it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe I do, but not the kind you think.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you own this ship?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A charter though the Explorer's Club.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: .What do you do?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I am many things. I am writer, a doctor, a nuclear physicist, a theoretical philosopher. Above all, I am a man, A hopelessly inquisitive Man, just like you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where's your money come from?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Many years of successful writing and publishing has made me self sufficient. Reader's in all languages have enjoyed my work - but now I'm retired to study the mid and the spirit...my life's true work.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: These studies have made me a target and I am hunted for what I know. Which is why... it is so un-wise to go lurking and jumping on strange ships.. .how do we know what your motives are?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: .well: I apologize if I got a little out of hand last night - I'm just... looking for work and your ship looked good, so...it's a nice looking ship.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't apologize. You're a scoundrel. How I miss the days of working a four mastered schooner with nothing but salt horse, dried peas and a couple quarts of water.. .the present-day maritimer's seem so much more fragile, don't you think? You - you're and adventurer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An able bodied seamen, a maker of wine, and a dashing mischievousness is what I knew would come to me in this-lifetime. .would you study with me? Submit yourself?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't understand what you're talking about.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I am always looking for mature men of unusual ability who are willing to stretch the boundaries of what they know. To increase knowing-ness and communication amongst man. I need day-ta. And with your help, I can gather it...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You already understand, you just need to remember. And only say yes. Say, 'yes.'

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not saying yes to anything I don't

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Master holds up the FLASK..

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's-about-this?'

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What about it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As a Scientist and a Conniseur I have no idea the contents of this remarkable potion, what's in it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Secrets.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can you make more?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll grant you a full reprive from your naughtiness as a stow-away if you make us some more. I must admit I sampled some and ended up drinking it all.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's just booze.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Horrible Hooch?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Horrible Hooch. BEAT. They both smile, laugh a little. MASTER gets up and comes over him...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Would you scrub yourself up and make yourself clean? My daughter is getting married. Come and join us and leave your worries for a while, they'll still be there when you get back..he he he. You are invited.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MASTER waits for him-they walk together...CAMERA leads them-they go up on DECK...OUT INTO THE PACIFIC OCEAN AIR...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think we have known each other before you and I -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh yeah?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It will come out over time, but yes. We are re-united... do you reember me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: .I don't know...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's alright. Don't strain yourself. You will. There will be much time to discuss this on the journey to our destination. As we travel down Time- Holes...you won't be afraid will you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: .what destination?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Have you ever had harm cme to you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sure.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What if we could return to a period of your life where there was harm and do away with it? .would You like that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ok.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's where we go. They come across ALL THE PEOPLE ON BOARD. THEY WALK INTO THE GROUP. Everyone is getting ready for a WEDDING. . .th greet MASTER and FREDDIE. He walks into it and is welcome'd... MASTER finds his daughter, ELIZABETH, who is to be married and her husband-to-be CLARK (20s) He introduces them to Freddie - EXT. DECK OF SHIP. AFTERNOON. ZOOM BACK FROM CU. On MASTER as he presides over his DAUGHTER's WEDDING. ELIZABETH and CLARK. Everyone dressed up; Master says some sweet,. beautiful words and then;

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: .as long as you hold these bodies, in this life: you may kiss the bride. THEY KISS. APPLAUSE, CHEERS. CU. FREDDIE. He listens and watches.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's mid-dinner, post-wedding ceremony party, everyone is celebrating, drinking. Master talking a blue streak, acting this out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now, now, now, how 'bout this: Here it comes - swooping down on me: A LARGE

dialogues.speaker: EYES
dialogues.text: What do I go? A lasoooo! Whip it up, wrap it around it's neck. I wrastle, wrastle, wrastle'em to the ground - I snap up, I say: sit. Everyone laughs, Master is acting all this out, rolling around, etc as if he's training a dog...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dragon sits. I say: stay. Sragon stays. So now he's got a leash on and he's staying on my command - THAT"S WHAT WHERE WERE AT WITH IT NOW - it stays on command. Everyone is laughing, lapping it all up. He glances;

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Next we're gonna teach it to roll over and play DEAD. Master sits down, starts speaking to someone about his days studying Judo ... FREDDIE, sitting up at the dinner table-across the table is: VAL, strikes up conversation:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Freddie, I'm Val, the son.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you having a good time?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you goign to be working on?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't really know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Have you done any time-hole work?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't think so. VAL is distracted by a WELL WISHER who comes over. FREDDIE looks around at everyone. All the faces having a good time and celebrating... He catches the eye of a YOUNG WOMAN. . .then sees her HUSBAND... The BARTENDER comes over to FREDDIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alright, old man?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No hard feelings?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Welcome aboard. Clif Amsbury. He serves him a drink.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This one's alright. Chink, chink. ANGLE, LATER. Master is saying good-night to everyone, passes FREDDIE and says quietly:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When can we have some of your potion?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Whenever you'd like. I'll get making it -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When I'd like it - I will give you a signal. I will scratch my ear and rub my nose. What will you need?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll take care of it. MASTER makes his way down the table trying to say goodbye to everyone, he finally tears away from the party by

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Enough! Enough! I must get back to work! Keep going! Dont stop all night long! He leaves. FREDDIE just looks around, caught up in it all.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Freddie comes down into his little room. A cot has been made for him, some fresh clothes and a BOOK (hardcover,400pages) on the bed. It reads, very simply:

dialogues.speaker: CU. BOOK "THE CAUSE"
dialogues.text: The cover is opened, CAMERA SEES IN CU the opening line from the book: "Shall a man be master of his memories? Or shall his memories be the master?"

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He lays in bed and reads the book. He reads about to lines and his eyes slam shit, asleep, still holding the book. HOLD.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's the next morning, EVERYONE IS HERE FOR BREAKFAST, BUFFET STYLE, FREDDIE mixed in amongst it all. FREDDIE sits down to eat with MARY SUE, who feeds her baby. The other children around. VAL and NORMAN CONRAD are here...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's been writing all night ...I think you've inspired something in hi,. When we're at home, on land, there's too much, pulling him in each direction.

dialogues.speaker: MARY SUE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: He was working on a book that showed how the Russians used narcosynthesis and physical torture and how it worked as it did. That was interrupted. He had a technology oh psychological warfare to present to the Defense Department. All that was interrupted, lost. Each time he sits to write, a new attack is launched against him and he spends too much time on defending himself. I tell him to ignore it, but he's so sensitive...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who's attacking him?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: People that are scared. People that are greedy. Ex-wives...That's what's so nice about being at sea. He gets his studies done, advances the learning, and he writes BOOK II.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's a time-hole?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's a dimly lit little room. A few folding chairs and a small stage. A YOUNG GOD LOOKING COUPLE: WAYNE and SUSAN DUNBAR (late 20s) are on stage. She is lying down, eyes close, he is sitting in a chair next to her, students watch as he runs an exercise with her; Mary Sue has brought Freddie in here and sits with him in the back.. .Freddie watches:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Say, "back beyond" and return to the pre- natal area.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Back beyond. Back beyond. Back beyond. Back beyond. Back beyond. Back beyond.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Continue please...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Back beyond..I Have.. something in my face... It feels like I am being pushed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Contact it more closely and continue to repeat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Back beyond. Back beyond. It's getting stronger.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I hear a voice..It's my father's voice.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Listen to the words and repeat them, please.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He is talking to my mother. The face pressure is hurting. It's uncomfortable. It keeps going up and down and it hurts.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Repeat his words, please.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "I don't want to come in you now. Let's wait." The pressure is banging my face. Into my face. My mother is there, her voice...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What is your mother saying? Please, if you hear her?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She saying "well get out of there then. I don't want you in me at all if your not there to come. Get in to come." She's mad.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Please return to the start of this and recount.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I wonder what they're doing? I hear a squishing sounds and it's wet. Oh. Oh my.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Recount please.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A faint rhythm ...then faster. I hear my fathers voice say, "oh honey..I wont come in you now. I'm not too sure I like children that well and I have my job to worry about..." And my mother must shove him - a sharper pain here - "THEN I DON'T

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Return to the beginning and recount it again, please. CU. FREDDIE's FACE Listening. Mary Sue leans over and whispers:

dialogues.speaker: MARY SUE, (WHISPERS)
dialogues.text: Do you understand what's happening?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes. She hold her pregnant stomach;

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We record everything.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: FREDDIE moves around, CAMERA follows him, collecting VARIOUS SUPPLIES to start making a home-made potion of booze. POTATOES, PAINT THINNER, ORANGES, YEAST. (TBD, OTHER CONTENTS OF THE SHIP) that could go into a recipe -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's set up in an area of the ship to start distilling BOOZE from the found ingredients on the ship. WATCH, HOLD THIS. The BARTENDER/FOLLOWER is here to give him some help. (poss. Bartender telling him how came to 'the cause' here...)

dialogues.speaker: STUDY TIME.
dialogues.text: He slips a PAIR of HEADPHONES ON, TAKES A SEAT AND LISTENS. This is a recording of a LIVE LECTURE BY MASTER:

dialogues.speaker: MASTER, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: .someone came up to me the other day, and I had to say...I had to correct him. He said, "I heard the Cause can fix me.." I looked down at him and he'd lost his legs. He's sitting in a wheel chair and had no legs to speak of. I said, "We can do very many things, sir...but no, we cannot replace your legs. This is how rumors get started." Let's talk about what we can do... FREDDIE looks around and watches all the STUDENTS on their headphones. He tries to flirt and make eye contact with all the WOMEN.

dialogues.speaker: MASTER, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: When did you decide you had limited potentials and capabilities? You've forgotten that this is all just a dirty old game that YOU created. An AID (Female, 40s) comes over;

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How you doing?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm fine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you following alright?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well-not really-no...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's OK. You will. Don't worry -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How long have you been studying

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A year. It takes a little time. Don't worry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's your name?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carol Henike. You're Freddie.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's right.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just keep listening and reading. If you don't udnerstand, just keep going back over it. Headphones back on... He slips the headphones back on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A SKETCH COMEDY SHOW, DANCING after-dinner. FREDDIE on the sidelines, watching it, not really understanding some of the humor and lyrics, etc...someone has a MOP on their head and is pretending to be a PSYCHOLOGIST with a vary thick/bad German-Austiran-accent. "zee muzzer and fazzer and zee penisss and ze nippelz.." attempting to cure a STUDENT... everyone LAUGHS. ELIZABETH (the daughter) comes over;

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hi Freddie ...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hi.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: .I Have a message for you. She rubs her nose and tugs her ear.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Better get along. He leaves, she watches him go.

dialogues.speaker: INT. FREDDIE'S AREA. MOMENTS LATER.
dialogues.text: He puts the booze into MASON JARS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Freddie pours the liquid into two glasses. WE HEAR THE PARTY OUTSIDE THE ROOM, FROM UPSTAIRS. MASTER examines

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's in it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: .drink just a little. It's very strong. The good stuff takes time. And there's secrets in good liquor. This is just booze for now...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How are you feeling, Freddie?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rested?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Excited?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sure.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Have you made some friends?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good. Good. How are you feeling?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, good. They CHEERS AND DRINK. Shudder at the strength of it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've been writing ... BULAGH! Feel like I went under. Dark cloud rolls in. Opens up...anxious to share new work-would you care for some informal processing?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sure...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, then I gather myself... and you be my protege and guinea pig, eh? Informal processing. Master smiles, excited, moves to an OLD TAPE RECORDER, points a microphones towards Freddie, looks over some papers...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you ready?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes. HE FLIPS THE TAPE RECORDER ON. Master smiles, reads,

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Say your name.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Freddie Sutton.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Say it again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Freddie Sutton.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Say it again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Freddie Sutton.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Might as well say it one more time just to make sure you know who you are...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Freddie Sutton.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you ever make thoughtless remarks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I usually put some thought into them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you browse though railway timetables just for pleasure?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you get occasional twitches of you muscles when there is no logical reason for it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (flutters around goofy) Only on my good days.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do past failures bother you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do past failures bother you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do past failures bother you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. (some dice games I was in, he he.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So past failures bother you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: .I don't know. . .you keep asking me..no, not really.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is your life a constant struggle for survival?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: .not really ... .. life's alright.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Would you rather give orders than take them?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sure.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you often impulsive in you behaviour.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: .sure... Yes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do other people interest you very much?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not really (girls? They do)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you find it easy to be impartial?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you likely to be jealous?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No .about what?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you logical and scientific in your thinking?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm..I don't know. Don't care about science.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you rarely suspect the actions of others?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't understand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes you do.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: .I suspect people...yes. Sure. So...no, rarely. Most people are ass's anyway.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you usually truthful to others?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: .no... I don't know. Guess so.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are your actions considered unpredictable by other people? HOLD. HOLD. Freddie seems to think about this questions seriously, THEN: OUT OF THE PAUSE AND OUT OF THE BLUE HE

dialogues.speaker: BLLLLLLLLLL GH.
dialogues.text: How's that? (laughs hysterically)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Silly..its good to laugh in processing.. sometimes we forget. Master reaches down, brings the microphone to his mouth:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "Freddie Sutton, Test Session. May 5, 1952, 1800 hours. Aboard he sailing vessel Aletheia, en route to New York City. MOC logged ad approced." He CLICKS it off. Smiles at Freddie; he gives him a comforting hug.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Should we sample another sip before we join them upstairs?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is that it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: For now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm ready for more if you want to ask me...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ask me, Master. This is fun.. .nobody's asked me questions before --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Could you answer the next series of questions without blinking your eyes? To without fear and hesitation answer as quickly as you can?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sure. CU. TAPE RECORDER BACK ON.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Everything's there isn't it? On the tape? Sure is, we just need to get it working with all the other pieces in synch-ro- nization. No good if it's not plugged into the wall. Can't hear it. But the sounds are still there. No good if those speakers aren't there. Can't hear it. (MORE)
MASTER (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But that doesn't mean it's not there, does it? No. It doesn't. That flimsy little piece of tape is just nothin' without all the other equipment lined up properly, isn't it? We CAN access the past, traumas and seeds that abberate us in present time and once we access them - we challenge them and throw them away. Previously, I'd established how to access these aberrations and painful memories to pre-birth/cellular times. But the new studies prove there is a time beyond that. The Whole-of-time with which we are now working. At last count, perhaps sixty-seven trillion years our studies show... Besides the everyday struggles of how we become better, more able, more productive homo sapiens, the uses for this new science is the location and removal of certain leukemias, apathies, manics. Depressives, perverts, stuttering, neuroses, ulcers, arthritis, and asthmas. This is the province and science of Cause. If you'll forgive me, I must sit down. Perhaps you've taken notice of my leg injury and limp damndest thing. You see it happens every time I come to Manhattan Island, its a wound I've never conquered and I'll tell you how I found out about, because I never knew what in the H was happening... Well I did some processing to find out. Took Mary Sue to ay me down and lead me back...we processed over three hours! And something came up. It was this: I lived a life before and suffered a great injury. Knee injury... It was just around 1888. A great number and year. Significant as the creation . year of the new york city sewer system if I'm not wrong... I was a thief and criminal, working late into the night robbing a bank in the western side of the island. (MORE)
MASTER (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The crime was committed with a revolver in hand. A Cole .45. My accomplices and I made it clear across town when we were ambushed by the local authorities. -- but I made a slip away. A digression into the under constructed sewer system. It was here that I could no be found - or so my thinking went. All my confidence and all my arrogance was brought upon me. Full in the face. For I was nose to nose with a twenty-five foot alligator in the New York City sewer. Oh brother! What a scare I was in for. Now if you've veer seen the SNAP! SNAP! SNAP! OF A GATOR - you'll remember the fear. You see, this being an island, and in those days more inhabited by creature than man, why wouldn't I meet such a beast? In my evasion -- I dropped the gold. The money I'd stolen in my getaway.. .not dropped, but stuffed in a newly cemented drain hole just around 125th Street... present day Harlem County I believe today. Yes. Yes. I stuffed it and made a getaway from both man and beast ГўВЂВћshattered my knee in five different places-turned into a piece of glass..woke up early in the morning somewhere near the present day Times Square-which was nothing more than a farm..quite a farm..but that's another story. So what does this say? Injuries stay with us don't they??..They sure do. How's it gonna go away. How? How? How'm I gonna fix this knee. How are any of us going to get better? More able? We Must Process The Whole Of Time. This Life and Pre Natal Cellular processing is not enough. We have Lived Many, Many, Many Lives. So anybody tat is not processing the whole of time - is doing a disservice to man and Will Not Get Better. I cannot put it more simply. (MORE)
MASTER (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And as for me now: I just need to find the time away from all of my writing to go back down and DO IT so I don't walk around with the darndest limp everytime I come to town! dialogues.text: Are you a religious people? MASTER

And if our teachings can reconcile these views it would be doing a great service to MANKIND - JOHN MORE

dialogues.text: I must say that I find it quite -- MASTER

dialogues.text: A party is in progress at HELEN SULLIVAN'S HOME which has been converted into a STUDY COLLEGE. It's beautiful, large, well-appointed home. A woman: JOAN BANKS is singing, ELIZABETH is playing piano. Everyone is here for a welcoming party, good time, cocktails, snacks, etc... JOAN (SINGING)

dialogues.speaker: AND FIND IT.
dialogues.text: (MORE)

dialogues.speaker: SS'S..
dialogues.text: Everyone applauds, laughs. MASTER is smitten, STANDING OVATION. MASTER walks over to JOAN to shake her hand... She whispers to him: JOAN (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you do with a student who keeps dreaming she is in bed with you? MASTER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get thee behind me -- JOAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And push. They disperse. PIANO STARTS IN AGAIN... Everyone is relaxed, sitting around. New faces (JOAN and HELEN) sit close to MASTER... A WOMAN is speaking (stories of Cause success she's had at her branch in Minneapolis) WOMAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: .a once-a-month meeting... this last Saturday night we had a chiropractor..and he spoke about 'Handwriting Analysis'... MASTER is distracted... as he listens: HE RUBS HIS NOSE AND PULLS HIS EAR, CATCHING FREDDIE'S EYE. As we hear the woman ramble on, FREDDIE gets his FLASK, moves discreetly to get a glass, make a drink and brings it to MASTER. This is unnoticed by everyone but MARY SUE. The WOMAN FINISHES TALKING: MASTER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cheers to that! Everyone raises their glasses and DRINKS. MASTER downs his new drink. A calm... then Master gently protificates:
MASTER (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Something that Joseph Smith had right: the breeding and the development of the group... doubled, tripled with certain. ..a certain marital structure... how clever. Something to look at deeply for a growth... MARY SUE looks at him. JOAN looks at him. HELEN looks at him. FREDDIE looks at all of it. Helen's husband John looks confused. MASTER (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: .the consideration of Celestial Marriage. Spiritual Wifery. Plural Unions. These cannot be overlooked so quickly... think of the speed at which a movement could grow... BEAT. Met with a strange silence. MARY SUE moves to get up. . .MASTER changes the topic slightly... MASTER (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: To live in the days of six-shooters and open frontier, that's what I'd like! My grandfather. Rancher. Wyoming. A criminal of the highest lineage, once told me he met a boy named Buckskin Joe... He keeps talking... CUT TO:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's the next morning. MASTER is getting ready, dressing in the bathroom, getting ready for his lectures... MARY SUE comes in, from behind him... she hugs him from behind.. .he smiles.. .she looks at him in the mirror, he looks at her ... . she REACHES AROUND, GETS INTO HIS PANT

dialogues.speaker: THE EYE AS SHE SAYS
dialogues.text: MARY SUE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You can do. Whatever you want. As long as I don't find out. And as long. As. Anyone I know. Doesn't know. Other than that. You stop this idea. And you put it back in its pants. It didn't work for them. And it's not gonna work for you. We. Have. Enough problems. Cum for me.
MASTER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes. Yes. MARY SUE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do it. And get your best behavior out... cum for me... MASTER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, master. MARY SUE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And no more of that boy's booze. MASTER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes master. He comes, collapses, sinks to the floor. She washes her hands and walks out of the bathroom. CUT TO:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A beautiful spring day. STUDENTS, FOLLOWERS, COME IN, SIGN IN... IN THE MAIN LIVING ROOM, on stage, MASTER is working with a WOMAN, processing her. She lays back on a couch set up...FULL CROWD of students watching... MASTER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Try to recall how you feel... WOMAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, I'm sort of glad it's the end.. MASTER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What happens next? WOMAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The doctor puts a stethoscope to her chest.. MASTER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What is the doctor wearing? WOMAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A white coat. MASTER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is there a smell in the room?.
WOMAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It smells like a hospital. MASTER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Try to imagine what a hospital smells like. WOMAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uugh. Uugh. Alright. MASTER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What does the doctor say? WOMAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He listens to her chest and says, "She's gone." FREDDIE and VAL are sitting in the front foyer of the house, facing each other in two folding chairs...we see the. STAGE IN THE B.G... .VAL is bored and nodding off to sleep ...FREDDIE watches VAL. FREDDIE kicks his chair -- FREDDIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wake up. Your Father's speaking.. .you could learn something. VAL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's that? FREDDIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You heard me. VAL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's making this up as he goes, don'tcha know..? You can sleep and wake up and not have missed anything... FREDDIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe you should pay more attention. VAL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You have something to say to me? FREDDIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm curly-q. Round in circles. So shut up. .FREDDIE takes a nice big drink from his FLASK... FREDDIE looks out the open front door: TWO POLICEMAN AND A MARSHALL are parking their cars and walking towards the house...

dialogues.speaker: FREDDIE.
dialogues.text: Watching them advance... He hesitates. He's not sure what to do. So he stays put... The MEN walk up to the house ...FREDDIE and VAL look: POLICEMAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're looking for Lancaster Dodd. FREDDIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know who that is... POLICEMAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: May we come in? FREDDIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. You cannot. VAL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes you can. He's up there - VAL points to the stage... VAL (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's him. FREDDIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You can't come in. Get outta here. MASTER, ON STAGE, looks out - AGAINST THE GLARE OF THE DOOR, he can recognize the FIGURES AS UNIFORMED... ANGLE, AT THE DOOR. POLICEMAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We have a civil warrant to serve to Lancaster Dodd to appear in Philadelphia Bankruptcy Court - an arrest warrant - VAL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stay out of their way, Freddie. MASTER walks down to see what's happening. MASTER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What is happening here? POLICEMAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you Lancaster Dodd? MASTER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes I Am.
POLICEMAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We have an arrest warrant for you, sir... MASTER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are the charges? POLICEMAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: By order of Pennsylvania District Court by the Mildred Purcell Foundation for wrongful withdraw of funds. And operating a medical school without a license. That's.what we'll have to take you in for MASTER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is a silly joke, no? MARSHALL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, sir it isn't. But we have to take you in and book and fingerprint you. MASTER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is comic opera. Is it illegal in this city to get better? MARSHALL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Please put your hands behind your back. MASTER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I have no disagreement with you boys doing your work in all its silliness as defenders of what code? What honor? What part of the galaxy? This is a scientific gathering - you will cuff me from the front, if you please -- He raises his ARMS for HANDCUFFS. FOLLOWERS COME FORWARD

dialogues.speaker: ARM AND A HOOK FOR A HAND STARTS SWINGING IT AROUND
dialogues.text: VET)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: FREDDIE gets into it and is pushed by a POLICEMAN which unleashes a WRATH IN HIM. IT VERY QUICKLY BECOMES A MINI- MELE.

dialogues.speaker: VIOLENT.
dialogues.text: MASTER, FREDDIE are taken away in hand cuffs. MARY SUE comes out, angry at the police, everyone is, etc. Quite a scene.
MASTER is actually trying to CALM FREDDIE DOWN, WHO IS

dialogues.speaker: GOING NUTS IN THE HANDCUFFS AND AT HIS TREATMENT
dialogues.text: MASTER (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Freddie, no, no, no, calm down, please, please. It's nothing, just laugh, we'll be out shortly, it's nothing. I, please, pleasue, Freddie -

dialogues.speaker: HIS FOREHEAD.
dialogues.text: MASTER is put into another car.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They arrive in CARS. FREDDIE in one.car. MASTER in the other. FREDDIE is STILL FIGHTING. THEY DRAG HIM. MASTER is speaking to him, trying to calm him down... CUT TO:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's hours later. FREDDIE is out of energy. MASTER sits with him. Old-fashioned holding cell. MASTER holds his FINGER TO HIS LIPS. MASTER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shhhhhhhhhhhhhhhh. He gets up close to FREDDIE, whispers in his ear; MASTER (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Whatever we say is undoubtably being monitored...speak in whispers. FREDDIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't want to talk to you right now. MASTER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is FBI work, Russians maybe... this... too much work for the AMA...
FREDDIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stop talking... MASTER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're fear of capture and imprisonment is an implant from millions of years ago. An Invader Force played games with your spirit as it.moved from one body to the next - free for a moment - it was free and the invader force captured it - spun you around in a device not unlike a grinder and hit you with waves of high wattage electrical impulses - quaver bolts to damage you. The impulse lodges and plants the push-pull instinct, dumped in scalding hot water, then freezing cold - a control mechanism - any legal action, a summons to court, the sight of a police officer, exposes a glandular reaction and anxiety wave of the highest order, TRIGGERED -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: the mere threat of arrest will make a psychotic breakdown. This happened to you and you are free to stop it. Their game and implants are no match for you. Laugh in their face. Laugh at it. These triggers are useless now. You created THEM so YOU can DESTROY THEM. MASTER pulls away ... FREDDIE looks at him. HOLD. FREDDIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Horseshit. MASTER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't have any opinions. I'm giving you facts. FREDDIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just shut-your-mouth? You're a fucking DRUNK. MASTER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ME shut my mouth? You're a fucking DRUNK. You CACTUS. Play a game with me? I don't think so, you little yo-yo. That ain't the way. You want to shut me up? I'm the best and only friend you have, shut me up from saving you? HELPING YOU. ONLY WAY. FIND ANOTHER ONE, YO-YO. You wanna get rid of this or live this way or MASTER it? (MORE)
MASTER (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You listen - you wanna spit in that cops face for touching you? I'm gonna beat him with you. Bash his skull in. BUT DON'T TURN ON ME, DRUNK. Long silence. They sit in it. FREDDIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Helen's house...all those girls walking around, the wives of ... . I want to fuck all of them. MASTER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sex is not an aberration. Never has been. So what's wrong? FREDDIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I want to fuck 'em all. I want to stick it in every one of them. MASTER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When did you forget that surviving was what you're supposed to do. Stick it in. Stick it in. FREDDIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't belong in here, man. I gotta get out of here... MASTER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You belong at sea. FREDDIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: .hmph... MASTER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: .You belong to Doris. FREDDIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why're you talking about her? MASTER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You think of Doris. The loss of her. Triggers millions of little shocks and. charges, doesn't it? That present-life loss. FREDDIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It was Val who let them in the house and told them who you were... Val did it. CUT TO:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MASTER enters the room, Freddie behind him...VAL'S BED IS MADE AND ALL HIS BELONGING ARE GONE...FREDDIE looks at the mirror on the wall. WRITTEN IN LIPSTICK a note to FREDDIE:

dialogues.speaker: MOMENTS LATER. SAME.
dialogues.text: MARY SUE is here, looking at it. She says to Master: MARY SUE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where's he going? What's he doing? MASTER sits on the bed, thinks. She leaves quickly, we hear her go down the hall and knock on ELIZABETH's door... ELIZABETH answers and the speak ...FREDDIE and MASTER look at each other; MASTER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: His mother was a paranoid schizophrenic who wanted to abort him. Right now he 'wants to be sick.' He's losing his war. CUT TO:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: FREDDIE is sitting outside the CLOSED DOOR to MASTER'S UPSTAIRS BEDROOM/OFFICE. We HEAR VOICES talking CLARK walks up and sits with FREDDIE, they sit in silence... trying to listen, but not hearing... CLARK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's done this before... FREDDIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What happened? CLARK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He ran out of money and came back. He's a squirrel. He's trying to get to The Split Saber, don't you think? To sell it. Sell it off to any of these DISSENTERS -
The door ... NORMAN CONRAD asks FREDDIE to come in...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: FREDDIE enters, sits down.. .DOOR CLOSES. They all face him, sit him in a chair... MASTER, ELIZABETH, NORMAN, MAR SUE... MASTER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There is a mission against time to be undertaken, Freddie. NORMAN CONRAD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you prepared to travel wherever we may ask you to go -- ? FREDDIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes. MASTER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- An assignment of importance in which more than just life hangs in the balance. MARY SUE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- I want to know if you can stop your boozing? FREDDIE MARY SUE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can you stop drinking? MASTER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- The drinking blocks the physical pain and dissolves treatment from working, FREDDIE -- MARY SUE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let me be unambiguous: Tell me you won't drink. ZOOM IN TOWARDS HIS FACE, ENDS IN CU. FREDDIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I won't drink. MARY SUE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your mission is to go to Phoenix, Arizona to prepare for a Universal Process Congress of the Cause. (MORE)

dialogues.speaker: MARY SUE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: All branches brought together for a summit ... your mission is to prepare for MOC's arrival and provide security at his home in Camel Foot Hills... NORMAN CONRAD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: .By bringing everyone together with the promise of unveiling new levels ... there will be interest from outside agencies ... the new works are of great many interests to dark forces... FREDDIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who? MARY SUE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CIA, Russians, Catholic Church. The list is long, Freddie. NORMAN CONRAD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We don't expect trouble, but if it comes... we believe and trust that you are the right man for this mission. ELIZABETH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're the only one that can do this, Freddie. FREDDIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: .What is Val doing in all this? MARY SUE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's a squirrel. And he has weaknesses. NORMAN CONRAD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you believe that no man can be neutral in the struggle between civilization and chaos? FREDDIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes. MARY SUE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Val's not a threat to you. You can handle Val. Can't you? CUT TO:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: FREDDIE and MASTER getting ready to leave. Just the two OF THEM:
MASTER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Freddie... there's something else...a side project I have for you... FREDDIE MASTER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: .When you get there...I need you to get something for me ... something of great importance to me. FREDDIE 7 MASTER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When you arrive at the house ... you go underneath the house. There's a crawl space. In the center of the house is a small hole. You will see broken soil that marks the spot.. .dig it up. Inside is a box. I need you to take the box and protect it. You can take it to the First Phoenix Bank and register a safe deposit. There it can stay until my arrival... FREDDIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What is it? MASTER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Valuables. Personal and confidential to me ... FREDDIE MASTER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Guardian of the Good for this civilization and all it's neighboring galaxies ... . can you promise me that you will safely deliver and protect this box? FREDDIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah. CUT TO:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: FREDDIE is waiting for his flight. MASTER and HELEN SULLIVAN and her husband JOHN are here...
HELEN sits with FREDDIE... HELEN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Whatever you're doing... . it feels right. FREDDIE looks at her. She looks at him CUT TO:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: FREDDIE is on board. A STEWARDESS comes down the aisle, asks if anyone wants a COCKTAIL. FREDDIE says no thank you. The MAN next to him has a nice GIN AND TONIC. FREDDIE is starting to sweat, gently shakes as he begins to de-tox... CUT TO:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: FREDDIE gets off the plane, walks to the terminal - he carries a DUFFLE BAG. Walking swiftly, purposefully... CUT TO:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: FREDDIE is in A CAB that pulls into a SUBURBAN PHOENIX NEIGHBORHOOD. He gets out in front of RANCH STYLE HOME separated a bit form the rest of the neighborhood ... THE CAB WAITS.

dialogues.speaker: THE HOUSE HAS BEEN TURNED UPSIDE DOWN AND RANSACKED.
dialogues.text: Freddie is shocked/nervous ... . suddenly on guard. FREDDIE walks around, looks into what appears to have been MASTER'S OFFICE... Writing, books, etc, thrown all over the place...

dialogues.speaker: RIPPED UP...
dialogues.text: CUT TO:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: UNDER THE HOUSE. A CRAWL SPACE. FREDDIE crawls on his belly underneath the house - goes to the center of it and (HAT

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: finds a HOLE. He digs into it...and digs up A BOX

dialogues.speaker: OFF. HE GOES BACK TO THE CAB AND GETS IN --
dialogues.text: CUT TO:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: FREDDIE pulls up in the cab to THE CAUSE H.Q. STOREFRONT OPERATION in downtown PHOENIX. He walks in...DICK BRETON (30s, Phoenix Branch Manager) is here - a few others. DICK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good morning. FREDDIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you Dick Breton? I'm Freddie Sutton. You're expecting me... FREDDIE is very friendly, but focused on the task, he asks to use the phone to call Master - some place private, perhaps... CUT TO:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: FREDDIE is alone, on the phone, with MASTER. MASTER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Freddie. FREDDIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Someone broke into the house. MASTER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: .Someone broke into the house...
FREDDIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Someone's been there. I don't know when. I may have just missed them - the front door was locked, I went in with the key and the house up ended, all smashed up on the ground - I walked to the back - the door was open - MASTER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- do you have the box? FREDDIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes. MASTER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where are you now? FREDDIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm at the office with Dick Breton. MASTER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is he there with you? FREDDIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's outside. The door's closed. MASTER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The box is safe in your hands? FREDDIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes. It was right where you said it would be...I haven't opened it. MASTER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You've done well. You know the severity of what you hold in your hands - FREDDIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is...did...did Val break into the house looking for it? MASTER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Possibly. A crazed lone lunatic for all we know. Certain atomic agencies wouldn't mind a crack at it, I'm sure. FREDDIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What should I do now? MASTER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get yourself a room at the Sun Inn Motel. The Sun Inn Motel ...it's nearby... acceptable accommodations. (MORE)     94 MASTER (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Find yourself a room there... and guard it until morning - stay safe until that bank opens... FREDDIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's good. I got it. MASTER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes it is. Are you alright? FREDDIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, yeah. I'm alright. I'm shaking.. MASTER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why? FREDDIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know. It's hot down here. MASTER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You feel any stomach pain? FREDDIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. MASTER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ringing in your ears? FREDDIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. MASTER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Left side feels good? FREDDIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah. MASTER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Right side feel good? FREDDIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm alright. MASTER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good, good. Alright, soldier. Go to it. FREDDIE hangs up and looks at the DUFFLE BAG.. .he looks out into the front area... sees DICK BRETON and some othe Phoenix Followers... they see Freddie.. .try to give him his space... He looks at the Duffle Bag. CUT TO:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: FREDDIE has checked into a motel for the night. He is sitting on the bed. THE BOX is on the next bed. He smokes cigarettes and looks at the box. He takes the BOX and puts it in his DUFFLE BAG. ZIPS IT UP. He turns off the light, smokes in the dark. ZOOM TOWARDS

dialogues.speaker: AND LEAVES IT ON THE BED.
dialogues.text: FREDDIE is starting to sweat and shake a bit. He's de- toxing. He looks down at his feet: HE HAS A TATTOO of a PIG on his right foot and a ROOSTER on his left... HE LOOKS AT THESE TATTOO'S... HE SPENDS SOME TIME IN THE TOILET THROWING UP. This goes on...until... CUT TO:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: FREDDIE is up, trying to get steady. Shaking, sweating... FREDDIE looks out the window, down across the street and sees the LOCAL BANK. The BANK MANAGER opens up...FREDDIE moves to leave. . .HE GRABS THE DUFFLE BAG FROM THE BED A WALKS OUT. CUT TO:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: FREDDIE cautiously comes out. He walks toward the stairs.. .and SEES:

dialogues.speaker: JUMPING ACROSS ROOFTOPS...
dialogues.text: FREDDIE makes his way down into the lobby of the motel.. . .very very very carefully... looking for someth around any corner... In the lobby... the OWNER nods to him... Freddie nods back... And makes a beeline - hard to the door and out into -- CUT TO:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: FREDDIE bursts out into the street in full-ready-for- anything mode ... . STRETCH OUT, MINI SEQUENCE... .looking up at the rooftops, alley's, etc... .He gets across the street, rounds a corner, and into - CUT TO:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: FREDDIE comes in, registers a SAFE DEPOSIT BOX. HE PUTS THE BOX IN THE SAFE DEPOSIT. HE LEAVES. CUT TO:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: FREDDIE speaking to a group of 20 followers; he reads some of this from a piece of paper ...he's shaking, sweating but doing a terrible job of concealing it... FREDDIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Phoenix will be the home of the Universe Process Congress of the Cause.. .to be held June 5th to 9th... Everyone is excited.
FREDDIE (CONT'D)

dialogues.text: That's what that means. BILL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown

BILL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown

dialogues.text: You know what this all is? Huh? It's mental cruelty. That's what it is. All the answers..."if you had that, it's no good 'cause here's the new thing.. .and oh no...you don't need that.. .that's old.. .this is new." And it's more and more and it's all just cruel. (MORE)

dialogues.text: Casue I wanted to know. She was too young when I knew her, when I saw her. how's Sonny? MOTHER

dialogues.text: Yep. Yeah. Alright. BEAT. FREDDIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown

dialogues.text: . am I leaving? MOTHER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown

FREDDIE

dialogues.text: Freddie; I ahve a matter of such urgency - a matter that only you can help me with - that may, in fact, cure the insane once and for all... BACK TO FREDDIE. .it's dark...he's drunk...he takes a step or two the wrong way - and FALLS...he not only falls down the steps but OVER THE BALCONY RAILING AND DOWN INTO THE MAIN AUDITORIUM... dialogues.text: You're alright. You're Superman. He looks at her. ELLEN

dialogues.text: I fell over the balcony.

dialogues.text: That's right. FREDDIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes. FREDDIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes. FREDDIE

dialogues.text: .why are you here? ELLEN

dialogues.text: .you're A mess...I can't see you this way...you...I've thought about you and what my life was life before the Cause and now. . .before I met you... .and you should be a Savior. You are. FREDDIE looks at her...she puts her head on him...
ELLEN

FREDDIE VOICE

dialogues.text: FREDDIE hangs up. He thinks. He thinks. He thinks. He looks at Ellen... she looks at him... CUT TO:

dialogues.text: What are these? What does this mean? FREDDIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They keep you from drowning... keep the sea from swallowing you..pig and rooster's always survive a shipwreck. ELLEN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How come they survive? FREDDIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know. They can swim better? Never thought about it. ELLEN

dialogues.text: Did you ever have a shipwreck? FREDDIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: .I did.
HOLD. He thinks about this. Ellen starts to get a little teary. She hugs his legs and feet, holds onto him... CUT TO:

VAL walks past FREDDIE... VAL sees FREDDIE. FREDDIE sees VAL. He stops, comes back.. .walks up to FREDDIE: VAL

dialogues.text: It's not up to me to decide how ou use it or if you use it. but if you want FACT. And scientific proof. This is it. REVERSE, MASTER. MASTER

dialogues.text: We don't need any photo's taken, Freddie. They all sit and look at each other. MARY SUE gets restless. She stands up... She leaves. It takes her a minute to walk across the huge room. . .PAUSE, THEN: MASTER looks at Freddie..MASTER goes into his desk, takes out a CONTRACT. MASTER

dialogues.text: We have a new contract. . .it says that you will serve the Cause above all other laws and regulations in this or any other neighboring galaxy for three billion years... .would you sign it? And join with me? FREDDIE MASTER

dialogues.text: It's not that long in the scheme of things, Freddie.. .he he he he he.. PAUSE. SILENCE between them ...then: MASTER starts to sing. . .and walk over to Freddie... serenades him;
MASTER

dialogues.text: Lighting up the night so bright, for all OF US

I'd love to get ya... on a slow boat to China all to myself alone... get you and keep ya, in my arms ever more. Leave all your lovers, weepin' on a far-away shore. Out on the briny with that moon big and shinee. Melting your heart of stone. Honey I'd love to get ya on a slow boat to China all to myself alone... They look at each other. CUT TO:
